unit_learning_outcomes.description: Demonstrate in-depth, broad and coherent knowledge of students' varied backgrounds and abilities and cater for these needs through differentiation.
Design engaging assessment tasks that align curriculum, instruction, assessment and reporting.
Implement and evaluate of a range of strategies including the use of ICT, classroom discussions, group work and effective use of questioning/listening to foster interest and support learning.
Critically reflect and use feedback from assessment data, observation, peer evaluation and lecturer evaluation to enhance learning outcomes.
Apply research-informed strategies for building depth of understanding in Stage 4/5 Geography.
Plan for, implement and critically reflect on effective units of work in Stage 4/5 Geography that provide achievable challenges for students of varying backgrounds and abilities.

assessments.description: Students use a backwards programming approach to design an assessment for learning task linking syllabus outcomes, activities, assessment and reporting/feedback. The task includes peer evaluation and structured rationale with reference to course readings.

Students plan a skills lesson using an explicit instruction approach. Lesson is delivered to the class. Students will be assessed on their ability to apply the principles of direct instruction and to teach core geographical concepts and skills using an integrated/authentic approach.
Students complete a geographical skills test.

data.subject_search_title: EDST8232 - Teaching Geography in the Secondary School 1
data.description: This unit focuses on the teaching of Geography in Years 7-10. Syllabus documents are examined and their implications analysed. Students develop and integrate an in-depth, broad and coherent knowledge the key pedagogies for teaching Stages 4/5 Geography. While the more 'traditional' teaching and learning strategies are addressed, greater emphasis is placed on those strategies that are student-centred and develop the students' ability to use and apply Geography's inquiry-based methodology. By the end of the unit students should have developed the knowledge, understanding and pedagogical skills required to enrich the teaching of Stage 4/5 Geography, and be capable of developing and implementing units of work from the relevant syllabus documents.
